title: BADecker
author: BADecker
content: Trump was a businessman. So is Musk. Musk as President has a better chance, because he is dynamic, and understands all the Swamp problems Trump went through much better. I mean, look at the Swamp activities Musk is revealing from twitter alone!From Dollar's Collapse To Musk As US President:https://www.zerohedge.com/markets/dollars-collapse-musk-us-president-russias-medvedev-makes-absurd-2023-predictionsFormer Russian president and current deputy chairman of the Security Council of the Russian Federation Dmitry Medvedev took to Twitter and Telegram Monday night to post his own predictions for 2023, in an unusual move from a former head of state, especially given a number of them are not just bizarre but most readers will receive them as incredibly unlikely - at least given the mere one year timeline.Describing that "many practice futuristic hypotheses," he said he would add his insight into the mix while "competing in the proposal of the most unexpected and even absurd" predictions. "On New Year's Eve, everybody's into making predictions," he began of his top ten predictions thread for 2023 which includes a coming civil war in the United States, the disintegration of the dollar, the crash of the IMF and World Bank, and the total collapse of the European Union, following a major war among competing powers in Western Europe - including war between Germany and France.Medvedev's thread caught the attention of Twitter and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, as among the predictions is that after a devastating internal US conflict, Musk would emerge as the new American president, to which Musk responded sarcastically "Epic thread!!"...And to be expected, a number of MSM pundits who happen to have large followings took Musk's reaction literally, missing that it was clearly said in mockery.----------Garry Kasparov@Kasparov63·When I wondered where Musk would find “his Medvedev”—a sycophantic nobody—to be Twitter CEO, I should have included Medvedev himself. Although who is more the sycophant here is unclear.Sergio Olmos@MrOlmosAmong the “epic”predictions in this thread are a civil war in the U.S., the collapse of Europe, a war between a fourth reich in Germany and France, the election of Elon musk as president after the end of the civil war(in which the GOP is in control)

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: But I thought the United States constitution did not allow people from other countries to be president?And I believe Elon Musk is from South Africa and also have Canadian nationality.So I believe it is very unlikely Musk will have any chance at all to even run for the presidency, unless the American people decided to have a referendum and adopt a new constitution adapted to modern times. That won't happen, I think.  QuoteArticle 2, Section 1 of the United States Constitution states that only natural-born citizens may serve as president. While the clause prevents immigrants who become U.S. citizens through naturalization from becoming president, it does not affect those with dual citizenship. Naturalization is the process through which a citizen of another country who moves the U.S. permanently can acquire citizenship.https://classroom.synonym.com/can-dual-citizenship-holder-president-us-15680.html

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: Hispo on December 28, 2022, 11:11:05 PMBut I thought the United States constitution did not allow people from other countries to be president?And I believe Elon Musk is from South Africa and also have Canadian nationality.So I believe it is very unlikely Musk will have any chance at all to even run for the presidency, unless the American people decided to have a referendum and adopt a new constitution adapted to modern times. That won't happen, I think.  QuoteArticle 2, Section 1 of the United States Constitution states that only natural-born citizens may serve as president. While the clause prevents immigrants who become U.S. citizens through naturalization from becoming president, it does not affect those with dual citizenship. Naturalization is the process through which a citizen of another country who moves the U.S. permanently can acquire citizenship.https://classroom.synonym.com/can-dual-citizenship-holder-president-us-15680.htmlThat might be the reason why it will never happen, but even if they changed those rules (seemed to find a workaround for a past president) I doubt Elon would have any interest in being President of the United States.  That is mostly a position for people who have spent their life in government living off the people without having ever earned a cent of revenue on their own, or disgraced lawyers.  At least that's my understanding of how it works.   Maybe that's why Trump was hated so much.  You aren't allowed to actually know how business works and be the President, then you might change the status quo of the government controlling everyone.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on December 28, 2022, 11:26:40 PMQuote from: Hispo on December 28, 2022, 11:11:05 PMBut I thought the United States constitution did not allow people from other countries to be president?And I believe Elon Musk is from South Africa and also have Canadian nationality.So I believe it is very unlikely Musk will have any chance at all to even run for the presidency, unless the American people decided to have a referendum and adopt a new constitution adapted to modern times. That won't happen, I think.  QuoteArticle 2, Section 1 of the United States Constitution states that only natural-born citizens may serve as president. While the clause prevents immigrants who become U.S. citizens through naturalization from becoming president, it does not affect those with dual citizenship. Naturalization is the process through which a citizen of another country who moves the U.S. permanently can acquire citizenship.https://classroom.synonym.com/can-dual-citizenship-holder-president-us-15680.htmlThat might be the reason why it will never happen, but even if they changed those rules (seemed to find a workaround for a past president) I doubt Elon would have any interest in being President of the United States.  That is mostly a position for people who have spent their life in government living off the people without having ever earned a cent of revenue on their own, or disgraced lawyers.  At least that's my understanding of how it works.   Maybe that's why Trump was hated so much.  You aren't allowed to actually know how business works and be the President, then you might change the status quo of the government controlling everyone.Now that you mention it, I have not heard about any other president of the United States who had their own businesses and things like that. I could be wrong since I do not live there in the USA, however, from the things I have read on your previous presidents, I think I can recall an important percentage of lawyers.Elon would run for president if he could, he seems to enjoy the attention and it will likely be good for his business and other's, because the tax cuts.

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: I read these predictions and it was indeed laughable. I wonder when Dmitry Medvedev was mentored by the famous Nostradamus to see the future. Anything is indeed possible but these predictions are far from being real and he didn't back his predictions with facts. The American presidency is not for sale, hence Elon Musk's wealth might not give him the seat. He would need the support of Americans which I doubt he has. UK going back to the EU is very unlikely because they are gradually coping with the challenges of Brexit. There might be some hidden disagreement between EU nations but the war in Ukraine has united the EU and their relationship is getting stronger

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: Quote from: Hispo on December 28, 2022, 11:11:05 PMBut I thought the United States constitution did not allow people from other countries to be president?And I believe Elon Musk is from South Africa and also have Canadian nationality.So I believe it is very unlikely Musk will have any chance at all to even run for the presidency, unless the American people decided to have a referendum and adopt a new constitution adapted to modern times. That won't happen, I think.  QuoteArticle 2, Section 1 of the United States Constitution states that only natural-born citizens may serve as president. While the clause prevents immigrants who become U.S. citizens through naturalization from becoming president, it does not affect those with dual citizenship. Naturalization is the process through which a citizen of another country who moves the U.S. permanently can acquire citizenship.https://classroom.synonym.com/can-dual-citizenship-holder-president-us-15680.htmlI don't think Musk really wants the President job. He tried to back out of the twitter deal because he knew how much flack it would get him, of course, along with its inability to financial stand without FBI funding.The Constitution is a piece of paper. It does nothing until it is activated in human form by people taking office. They do what they want. If nobody forces them to obey their oath of office, they do whatever they want. Right now there is a lawsuit in the Supreme Court regarding punishing a lot of major government people for not obeying their oath - https://www.supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/22/22-380/243739/20221027152243533_20221027-152110-95757954-00007015.pdf.Quote from: Zlantann on December 29, 2022, 10:31:41 AMI read these predictions and it was indeed laughable. I wonder when Dmitry Medvedev was mentored by the famous Nostradamus to see the future. Anything is indeed possible but these predictions are far from being real and he didn't back his predictions with facts. The American presidency is not for sale, hence Elon Musk's wealth might not give him the seat. He would need the support of Americans which I doubt he has. UK going back to the EU is very unlikely because they are gradually coping with the challenges of Brexit. There might be some hidden disagreement between EU nations but the war in Ukraine has united the EU and their relationship is getting stronger Medvedev showing us the facts that go on in meetings in the Kremlin, is something that we won't see until the Russian government wants us to see them.We can see from the purchase of the media, big tech, Biden and Harris, Congress, etc. ... by the way they got paid by the world wealthy elite to steal the Presidency from Trump... that we in the US have the best government that money can buy... although Biden is dragging us down a lot his first half-term.
